verses.verse: I also have become (Ps. 22:7; Jer. 18:16; Lam. 2:15) a reproach to them; When they look at me, (Matt. 27:39; Mark 15:29) they shake their heads.
Help me, O LORD my God! Oh, save me according to Your mercy,
(Job 37:7) That they may know that this is Your hand— That You, LORD, have done it!
(2 Sam. 6:11, 12) Let them curse, but You bless; When they arise, let them be ashamed, But let (Is. 65:14) Your servant rejoice.
(Job 8:22; Ps. 35:26) Let my accusers be clothed with shame, And let them cover themselves with their own disgrace as with a mantle.
I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; Yes, (Ps. 35:18; 111:1) I will praise Him among the multitude.
For ((Ps. 16:8)) He shall stand at the right hand of the poor, To save him from those who condemn him.

(Announcement of the Messiah’s Reign) A Psalm of David. [1] The (Matt. 22:44; Mark 12:36; 16:19; Luke 20:42, 43; Acts 2:34, 35; Col. 3:1; Heb. 1:13) LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand, Till I make Your enemies Your ((1 Cor. 15:25; Eph. 1:22)) footstool.”
The LORD shall send the rod of Your strength ((Rom. 11:26, 27)) out of Zion. ((Ps. 2:9; Dan. 7:13, 14)) Rule in the midst of Your enemies!
(Judg. 5:2; Neh. 11:2) Your people shall be volunteers In the day of Your power; (1 Chr. 16:29; Ps. 96:9) In the beauties of holiness, from the womb of the morning, You have the dew of Your youth.
